channel.title: What is running/What can I run on my robot on
channel.description: Recent content in What is running/What can I run on my robot on

item.title: Installed packages
item.description: Reachy runs on ROS 2 version Foxy, which should now be installed and configured on your computer. You have 2 main folders that contain all the packages you need to control Reachy. reachy_ws/src folder This folder contains all the ROS packages used with Reachy: reachy_msgs: https://github.com/pollen-robotics/reachy_msgs reachy_sdk_server: https://github.com/pollen-robotics/reachy_sdk_server reachy_controllers: https://github.com/pollen-robotics/reachy_controllers reachy_kinematics: https://github.com/pollen-robotics/reachy_kinematics dev folder This folder contains all the packages used with Reachy that are not based on ROS:

item.title: Levels of services
item.description: If you have a Full kit, reachy_sdk_server.service is enabled by default, which means that all services and levels of services are automatically available when you start the robot (see section Using services for more information on the services). ROS level The robot is based on ROS 2 version Foxy, which is used as the base of all our other services. You can see all ROS2 running services with: ros2 service list Launch kinematics services Kinematics services are available to provide inverse and forward kinematics services for the arms, as well as inverse kinematics for Orbita.
